metadata.titleEn: A dense station-based long-term and high-accuracy dataset of daily surface solar radiation in China
metadata.titleCn: 中国基于站点估算的长序列、高密集、高精度地表日平均太阳辐射数据集
metadata.description: The lack of long-term and high-quality solar radiation data has been an obstacle for scientific and industrial fields. In this study, a dense station-based long-term and high-accuracy dataset of daily surface solar radiation was developed with two surface radiation models. One is the model developed by Yang et al. (2006) for global radiation estimate, and the other is the model developed by Tang et al. (2018) for direct radiation estimate. The main inputs for developing the dataset are surface pressure, air temperature, relative humidity, horizontal visibility, and sunshine duration, which are the routine meteorological variables observed at the 2743 China Meteorological Administration (CMA) weather stations. Validation against in-situ observations and comparisons with two satellite-based radiation products show that our station-based radiation dataset clearly outperforms the satellite-based radiation products at both daily and monthly scales. In addition, our dataset is available for more than 60 years and includes three radiation components of global, direct and diffuse radiation, which is not possible with satellite products. This station-based radiation dataset will contribute to the climate change research and solar energy engineering applications in the future.
metadata.descriptionCn: 缺乏长序列、高质量太阳辐射数据一直是困扰科学界和工业界的难题。本研究利用两个地表辐射模型开发了一套基于站点估算的长序列、高密集、高分辨率日平均地表太阳辐射数据集。一个模型是Yang等人（2006）开发的总辐射估算模型，另一个模型是Tang等人（2018）开发的直接辐射估算模型。辐射数据集开发所需的主要输入是：中国气象局（CMA）2743个常规气象站观测的地表气压、气温、相对湿度、水平能见度和日照时数等常规气象变量。基于地表辐射观测的验证以及和两个基于卫星估算的辐射产品的对比表明，我们基于站点估算的辐射数据集在日尺度和月尺度上都明显优于基于卫星反演的辐射产品。此外，我们发展的数据集长度超过60年，且包括总辐射、直接辐射和散射辐射三要素，这个优势是卫星辐射产品不具备的。本研究发展的基于站点估算的辐射数据集将有助于气候变化研究和太阳能工程应用。
metadata.instructions: File name: the data set contains 2474 files, including station. txt file mainly describe the information on the site of 2473, corresponding to each column: longitude, latitude and elevation; and 2473 files of 2473 stations data (for example: 50136 rad. daily. txt)， corresponding to each column  on the data of 2473: year, month, day and global radiation, direct radiation and diffuse radiation.Data read method: the data set all of the ASCII file can be directly opened by text program (like notepad).
metadata.instructionsCn:
文件命名：该数据集共包含2474个文件，其中station.txt文件主要描述2473个站的站点信息，每列分别对应为：经度、纬度和高程；另外以(站号+rad.daily,例如:50136rad.daily.txt)命名的2473个文件对应2473个站的数据，文件中每列分别为：年、月、日和总辐射、直接辐射和散射辐射。 
数据读取方式：该数据集中的所有ASCII码文件可以直接用文本程序（如记事本）打开。

background: Solar radiation provides energy to everything on Earth; drives the water, energy and carbon cycles of the Earth’s climate system; and largely determines the climatic conditions of human habitats (Wild, 2009). Solar radiation information at the Earth’s surface is crucial in research of agriculture, hydrology, ecology and climate change and in simulations of land surface processes (Wang et al., 2012). Global radiation is an important component of the surface energy budgets (Wild et al., 2015), and accurate global radiation data will contribute to the simulation of land-surface-related processes, such as ecological, hydrological, agricultural and glacial simulations (Tang et al., 2019b). Due to its multi-directional nature, diffuse radiation penetrates the vegetation canopy more than direct radiation, and more diffuse radiation can increase the light energy use efficiency of the canopy (Mercado et al., 2009; Yang et al., 2019). In situ measurements are considered to be the most effective and direct means of obtaining surface solar radiation data. However, the number of radiation observation stations is very low due to high maintenance and calibration costs. Therefore, the lack of long-term and dense solar radiation observations has become a tough challenge. Satellites can provide continuous spatiotemporal observations, and retrieval based on satellite remote sensing is considered to be one of the most effective and commonly used means to fill the gap in ground-based radiation measurements (Lu et al., 2011; Zhang et al., 2014; Huang et al., 2019; Wang et al., 2020; Letu et al., 2021).
research objective: In this study, a dense station-based, long-term and high-accuracy dataset of daily surface solar radiation was developed using two surface radiation models. This station-based radiation dataset will contribute to the climate change research and solar energy engineering applications in the future. Therefore, these two hybrid models provide us with an opportunity to construct daily surface solar radiation at routine weather stations once the observations of meteorological variables are available. The constructed dataset will contribute to simulations of land surface processes, climate change analysis and solar energy applications. This long-term dataset will contribute to the analysis of long-term variations in surface process simulations and solar energy applications, such as the assessment of solar energy potential, the determination of the optimal angle for solar PV panels and their long-term variation analysis, as well as the assessment of historical extreme events in solar energy systems.
challenges: Another issue is that the radiation observation stations are very unevenly distributed, with most of radiation stations being located in flat and densely populated areas and with a very small number of stations being located in complex-terrain areas and sparsely populated areas. In addition, radiation measurements are considered to be more prone to problems and unreliable data than those of other meteorological variables. For example, erroneous or spurious data were frequently found in the CMA radiation observations (Shi et al., 2008; Tang et al., 2011). Therefore, the lack of long-term and dense solar radiation observations has become a tough challenge. First, the time series of satellite radiation products are generally not long enough to meet the demand for long-time-series data, such as for climate change studies. Second, the updating of satellite sensors and the fusion of multi-source satellites would lead to inconsistent data quality and introduce large uncertainties into the analysis of long-term variations (Feng and Wang, 2021a; Shao et al., 2022). Third, most satellite radiation products only provide global radiation but do not include direct and diffuse radiation because the uncertainty in algorithms for estimating direct and diffuse radiation is much larger than the uncertainty in global radiation.
methods: In this study, daily global radiation and daily direct radiation were estimated using the hybrid model of Yang et al. (2006) and the method developed by Tang et al. (2018). Finally, daily diffuse radiation was calculated by subtracting direct radiation from global radiation. The methods for estimating daily global, direct and diffuse radiation can be simply described by the following five mathematical formulas: Rg =(Rb,clr +Rd,clr)τc,g, (1) Rb =Rb,clrτc,b, (2) Rd =Rg −Rb, (3) τc,g =0.2505 +1.1468(n/N)−0.3974(n/N)2, (4) τc,b =0.4868(n/N)+0.5132(n/N)2, (5). The overall flowchart for the estimation of the station-based radiation products is shown in Fig. 1, which consists mainly of input, model and output sections.
dataset: The main inputs for the development of the dataset are surface pressure, air temperature, relative humidity, horizontal visibility and sunshine duration, which are the routine meteorological variables observed at the 2743 China Meteorological Administration (CMA) weather stations. Finally, in this study, a dataset of more than 60 years of daily global, direct and diffuse radiation was constructed using the methods described above at the 2473 CMA routine meteorological stations from the 1950s to 2021, with most stations covering the period of 1961–2021.
findings: Validation against in situ observations and comparisons with two satellite-based radiation products shows that our station-based radiation dataset clearly outperforms the satellite-based radiation products at both daily and monthly scales. Averaged over all radiation stations and the time period of 1993–2010, the total RMSE values for daily global, direct and diffuse radiation are 23.2, 27.6 and 19.6 W m−2, respectively. At the monthly mean scale, our estimates give RMSE values of about 13.4, 16.5 and 10.9 W m−2, respectively, for monthly global, direct and diffuse radiation. These error indicators on both daily and monthly scales are generally lower than those of the satellite radiation products, especially for global and direct radiation.
backgroundCn: 太阳辐射为地球上的一切提供能量；驱动地球气候系统的水、能量和碳循环；并在很大程度上决定人类栖息地的气候条件（Wild, 2009）。地表的太阳辐射信息在农业、水文学、生态学和气候变化研究中至关重要，并在陆地表面过程的模拟中发挥重要作用（Wang et al., 2012）。全球辐射是地表能量预算的重要组成部分（Wild et al., 2015），准确的全球辐射数据将有助于陆地表面相关过程的模拟，如生态、 hydrological、农业和冰川模拟（Tang et al., 2019b）。由于其多方向特性，散射辐射比直接辐射更能穿透植被冠层，更多的散射辐射可以提高冠层的光能利用效率（Mercado et al., 2009；Yang et al., 2019）。就地测量被认为是获取地表太阳辐射数据最有效和直接的方法。然而，由于高维护和校准成本，辐射观测站的数量非常少。因此，缺乏长期和密集的太阳辐射观测已成为一个严峻的挑战。卫星可以提供连续的时空观测，基于卫星遥感的检索被认为是填补地面辐射测量空白的最有效和最常用的方法之一（Lu et al., 2011；Zhang et al., 2014；Huang et al., 2019；Wang et al., 2020；Letu et al., 2021）。
research objectiveCn: 在这项研究中，开发了一个基于站点的密集型、长期和高精度的日照数据集，使用了两种表面辐射模型。这个基于站点的辐射数据集将为未来的气候变化研究和太阳能工程应用做出贡献。因此，这两种混合模型为我们提供了一个机会，一旦获得气象变量的观测数据，就可以在常规气象站构建日照数据集。构建的数据集将有助于土地表面过程的模拟、气候变化分析和太阳能应用。这一长期数据集将有助于分析土地表面过程模拟和太阳能应用的长期变化，例如评估太阳能潜力、确定太阳能光伏面板的最佳角度及其长期变化分析，以及评估太阳能系统中的历史极端事件。
challengesCn: 另一个问题是辐射观测站的分布非常不均匀，大多数辐射站位于平坦和人口稠密的地区，而在复杂地形和人口稀少的地区则只有很少的站点。此外，辐射测量被认为比其他气象变量更容易出现问题和不可靠的数据。例如，在中国气象局的辐射观测中，常常发现错误或虚假的数据（Shi et al., 2008; Tang et al., 2011）。因此，缺乏长期和密集的太阳辐射观测已成为一个严峻的挑战。首先，卫星辐射产品的时间序列通常不够长，无法满足气候变化研究等对长期数据的需求。其次，卫星传感器的更新和多源卫星的融合会导致数据质量不一致，并给长期变化的分析引入较大的不确定性（Feng and Wang, 2021a; Shao et al., 2022）。第三，大多数卫星辐射产品仅提供全球辐射，而不包括直接辐射和散射辐射，因为估算直接辐射和散射辐射的算法的不确定性远大于全球辐射的不确定性。
methodsCn:
在本研究中，使用Yang等人（2006年）的混合模型和Tang等人（2018年）开发的方法估算了每日全球辐射和每日直接辐射。最后，通过从全球辐射中减去直接辐射计算了每日散射辐射。估算每日全球辐射、直接辐射和散射辐射的方法可以用以下五个数学公式简单描述： 

Rg =(Rb,clr +Rd,clr)τc,g, (1) 
Rb =Rb,clrτc,b, (2) 
Rd =Rg −Rb, (3) 
τc,g =0.2505 +1.1468(n/N)−0.3974(n/N)2, (4) 
τc,b =0.4868(n/N)+0.5132(n/N)2, (5)。 

估算基于站点的辐射产品的整体流程图如图1所示，主要由输入、模型和输出部分组成。
datasetCn: 该数据集的主要输入为地面气压、气温、相对湿度、水平能见度和日照时长，这些是2743个中国气象局（CMA）气象站常规观测的气象变量。最终，在本研究中，利用上述方法构建了一个超过60年的日全球、直接和散射辐射数据集，该数据集涵盖了2473个CMA常规气象站，时间范围从1950年代到2021年，大多数站点的观测期为1961年至2021年。
findingsCn: 与现场观测的验证以及与两种基于卫星的辐射产品的比较表明，我们的基于站点的辐射数据集在日尺度和月尺度上明显优于基于卫星的辐射产品。在1993年至2010年期间，所有辐射站的平均总均方根误差（RMSE）值为：日全球辐射23.2 W m−2，日直接辐射27.6 W m−2，日散射辐射19.6 W m−2。月均尺度上，我们的估计值的RMSE值分别约为：月全球辐射13.4 W m−2，月直接辐射16.5 W m−2，月散射辐射10.9 W m−2。这些在日尺度和月尺度上的误差指标通常低于卫星辐射产品的误差，特别是在全球辐射和直接辐射方面。

Verification.QuestionEn: Is it possible to estimate daily global, direct, and diffuse radiation using hybrid models based on routine meteorological observations?
Verification.QuestionCn: 可以使用基于常规气象观测的混合模型来估计每日全球、直接和散射辐射吗？

Verification.QuestionEn: Are the main inputs for developing a dataset of long-term solar radiation data derived from surface pressure, air temperature, relative humidity, horizontal visibility, and sunshine duration?
Verification.QuestionCn: 开发长期太阳辐射数据集的主要输入是否来自地面气压、气温、相对湿度、水平能见度和日照时长？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Is the main data collection method for solar radiation datasets based on in situ measurements, satellite remote sensing, or hybrid models?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 太阳辐射数据集的主要数据收集方法是基于现场测量、卫星遥感还是混合模型？

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Are the challenges in collecting solar radiation data primarily due to high maintenance costs, uneven distribution of stations, or unreliable data?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 收集太阳辐射数据的挑战主要是由于高维护成本、站点分布不均还是数据不可靠？
Disjunctive.AnswerEn: uneven distribution of stations, unreliable data
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 站点分布不均，数据不可靠

Disjunctive.QuestionEn: Does the solar radiation dataset mainly include global radiation, direct radiation, or diffuse radiation?
Disjunctive.QuestionCn: 太阳辐射数据集主要包括全球辐射、直接辐射还是散射辐射？
Disjunctive.AnswerEn: global radiation, direct radiation, diffuse radiation
Disjunctive.AnswerCn: 全球辐射，直接辐射，散射辐射

Concept Completion.QuestionEn: What are the primary inputs required for developing a station-based solar radiation dataset?
Concept Completion.QuestionCn: 开发基于站点的太阳辐射数据集所需的主要输入是什么？
Concept Completion.AnswerEn: surface pressure, air temperature, relative humidity, horizontal visibility, sunshine duration
Concept Completion.AnswerCn: 地面气压、空气温度、相对湿度、水平能见度、日照时长

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of how in situ measurements are used as a data collection method for obtaining surface solar radiation data?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个示例，说明如何使用原位测量作为获取表面太阳辐射数据的数据收集方法？
Example.AnswerEn: In situ measurements are considered the most effective and direct means of obtaining surface solar radiation data. However, the number of radiation observation stations is very low due to high maintenance and calibration costs.
Example.AnswerCn: 原位测量被认为是获取地表太阳辐射数据最有效和直接的方法。然而，由于维护和校准成本高，辐射观测站的数量非常少。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the core characteristics of a dataset used for estimating long-term surface solar radiation?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于估计长期地表太阳辐射的数据集的核心特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: daily global, direct, and diffuse radiation data, surface pressure, air temperature, relative humidity, horizontal visibility, sunshine duration, spans over 60 years, covering periods from the 1950s to 2021, most data collected from 1961 to 2021
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 每日全球、直接和散射辐射数据、地面气压、空气温度、相对湿度、水平能见度、日照时数，数据跨度超过60年，涵盖从1950年代到2021年的时期，大部分数据收集于1961年至2021年。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the defining features of the methods used to estimate daily global, direct, and diffuse solar radiation in a station-based dataset?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于估计基于站点的数据集中每日全球、直接和散射太阳辐射的方法的定义特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: hybrid model, mathematical formulas, specific models, sunshine duration, meteorological variables
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 混合模型，数学公式，特定模型，日照时长，气象变量

Definition.QuestionEn: What is meant by a 'station-based radiation dataset' in the context of solar radiation data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在太阳辐射数据收集的背景下，“基于站点的辐射数据集”是指通过特定的测量站点收集的辐射数据。这些测量站点通常配备有仪器，用于监测和记录太阳辐射的强度和变化，以便进行分析和研究。
Definition.AnswerEn: A 'station-based radiation dataset' refers to a collection of solar radiation data that is estimated and recorded at ground-based weather stations. In this context, it involves the use of meteorological variables observed at these stations to estimate daily global, direct, and diffuse solar radiation using specific radiation models.
Definition.AnswerCn: “基于站点的辐射数据集”是指在地面气象站估算和记录的太阳辐射数据的集合。在这个背景下，它涉及使用在这些站点观察到的气象变量，通过特定的辐射模型来估算每日的全球辐射、直接辐射和散射辐射。

Definition.QuestionEn: What are the 'routine meteorological variables' used in developing solar radiation datasets?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在开发太阳辐射数据集时使用的“常规气象变量”包括哪些？
Definition.AnswerEn: The 'routine meteorological variables' used in developing solar radiation datasets include surface pressure, air temperature, relative humidity, horizontal visibility, and sunshine duration. These variables are crucial as inputs for the radiation estimation models employed to construct the radiation dataset at various weather stations.
Definition.AnswerCn: 用于开发太阳辐射数据集的“常规气象变量”包括地面气压、气温、相对湿度、水平能见度和日照时长。这些变量作为辐射估算模型的输入，对于在各个气象站构建辐射数据集至关重要。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for solar radiation using station-based models compare to satellite-based retrieval methods in terms of data accuracy and reliability?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 太阳辐射的站点模型数据收集方法与卫星遥感方法在数据准确性和可靠性方面如何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Station-based models, which use routine meteorological variables observed at weather stations, tend to provide more accurate and reliable solar radiation data at both daily and monthly scales compared to satellite-based retrieval methods. Satellite-based methods provide continuous spatiotemporal observations but often suffer from longer-term data consistency issues and generally higher uncertainty, especially for direct and diffuse radiation.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 基于站点的模型使用气象站观测的常规气象变量，通常在日尺度和月尺度上提供比卫星遥感方法更准确和可靠的太阳辐射数据。卫星基于的方法提供连续的时空观测，但往往存在长期数据一致性问题，并且通常具有更高的不确定性，特别是在直接辐射和散射辐射方面。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in challenges faced when using in situ measurements for solar radiation data collection compared to satellite observations?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用原位测量收集太阳辐射数据与卫星观测相比，面临的挑战有哪些不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: In situ measurements are limited by the uneven distribution of radiation observation stations and high maintenance costs, resulting in sparse data coverage, especially in complex-terrain areas. In contrast, satellite observations provide broader spatiotemporal coverage but face challenges such as shorter time series, inconsistencies due to sensor updates, and higher algorithmic uncertainties, particularly for direct and diffuse radiation.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 原位测量受到辐射观测站分布不均和高维护成本的限制，导致数据覆盖稀疏，尤其是在复杂地形区域。相比之下，卫星观测提供了更广泛的时空覆盖，但面临着时间序列较短、传感器更新导致的不一致性以及算法不确定性较高的挑战，特别是在直接辐射和散射辐射方面。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the long-term data availability and component inclusion (global, direct, diffuse radiation) differ between datasets constructed from station-based models and those derived from satellite data?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 长期数据的可用性和组成成分（全球辐射、直接辐射、散射辐射）在基于站点模型构建的数据集与基于卫星数据得出的数据集之间有何不同？
Comparison.AnswerEn: Station-based datasets offer long-term data availability, often exceeding 60 years, and include global, direct, and diffuse radiation components. Conversely, satellite-derived datasets typically have shorter time series and primarily focus on global radiation, lacking detailed components like direct and diffuse radiation due to higher estimation uncertainties.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 基于站点的数据集提供了长期的数据可用性，通常超过60年，并包括全球、直接和散射辐射成分。相反，卫星衍生的数据集通常具有较短的时间序列，主要关注全球辐射，由于估计不确定性较高，缺乏直接和散射辐射等详细成分。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What challenges can be inferred from the reliance on meteorological variables for estimating solar radiation data in complex-terrain areas?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 从对气象变量依赖以估算复杂地形地区的太阳辐射数据中，可以推断出哪些挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The reliance on meteorological variables for estimating solar radiation data in complex-terrain areas can present challenges due to the uneven distribution of radiation observation stations, which are more densely located in flat, populated areas. Additionally, the accuracy of radiation measurements can be compromised due to problems and unreliable data, further exacerbating the difficulty in obtaining consistent and reliable solar radiation data in these regions.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 在复杂地形地区，依赖气象变量来估算太阳辐射数据可能会面临挑战，因为辐射观测站的分布不均，通常在平坦、人口密集的地区更为密集。此外，由于测量问题和不可靠的数据，辐射测量的准确性可能受到影响，这进一步加剧了在这些地区获取一致和可靠的太阳辐射数据的困难。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How might the integration of satellite data with ground-based observations improve the estimation of long-term solar radiation datasets?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 卫星数据与地面观测的结合如何改善长期太阳辐射数据集的估算？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The integration of satellite data with ground-based observations could potentially improve the estimation of long-term solar radiation datasets by providing continuous spatiotemporal observations that fill gaps in ground-based measurements. However, challenges such as inconsistent data quality due to sensor updates and multi-source data fusion need to be addressed to minimize uncertainties in long-term variation analysis.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 卫星数据与地面观测的结合有可能通过提供连续的时空观测来改善长期太阳辐射数据集的估算，从而填补地面测量中的空白。然而，由于传感器更新导致的数据质量不一致以及多源数据融合等挑战需要解决，以最小化长期变化分析中的不确定性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors contribute to the challenges in maintaining long-term and dense solar radiation observations?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 维持长期和密集的太阳辐射观测面临的挑战有哪些因素？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The challenges in maintaining long-term and dense solar radiation observations arise from the high maintenance and calibration costs associated with radiation observation stations, their uneven distribution, and the presence of erroneous or spurious data in radiation measurements.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 维护长期和密集的太阳辐射观测面临的挑战包括辐射观测站的高维护和校准成本、观测站分布不均以及辐射测量中存在的错误或虚假数据。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is it difficult to achieve consistent data quality in satellite radiation products for long-term analysis?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 为什么在长期分析中实现卫星辐射产品的一致数据质量很困难？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Achieving consistent data quality in satellite radiation products is difficult due to the changing technology of satellite sensors and the fusion of multi-source satellites, which introduce large uncertainties and inconsistencies in data quality for long-term analysis.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 由于卫星传感器技术的不断变化以及多源卫星的融合，卫星辐射产品中实现一致的数据质量变得困难，这为长期分析引入了较大的不确定性和不一致性。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What are the reasons behind the superiority of station-based radiation datasets over satellite-based products on daily and monthly scales?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 站点基础辐射数据集在日尺度和月尺度上优于卫星基础产品的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Station-based radiation datasets outperform satellite-based products due to their higher accuracy on daily and monthly scales, as evidenced by lower RMSE values for global, direct, and diffuse radiation, which are especially significant in comparison to satellite-based radiation products.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 基于站点的辐射数据集在日尺度和月尺度上优于卫星产品，因为其具有更高的准确性，全球、直接和散射辐射的均方根误差（RMSE）值更低，这在与卫星辐射产品的比较中尤为显著。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What might be the impact on data reliability when collecting solar radiation data in areas with varying terrain complexity and population density?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 在地形复杂和人口密度不同的地区收集太阳辐射数据时，数据可靠性可能会受到什么影响？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The impact on data reliability in areas with varying terrain complexity and population density can be significant, as radiation observation stations are unevenly distributed. Most are located in flat, densely populated areas, leading to potential data gaps and reliability issues in complex or sparsely populated areas.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 在地形复杂和人口密度不同的地区，数据可靠性的影响可能是显著的，因为辐射观测站的分布不均。大多数观测站位于平坦、人口密集的地区，这导致在复杂或人口稀少的地区可能出现数据缺口和可靠性问题。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How might satellite-based radiation data products influence the long-term analysis of climate change if they do not include direct and diffuse radiation components?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 如果卫星基于辐射的数据产品不包括直接和散射辐射成分，那么它们将如何影响气候变化的长期分析？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Satellite-based radiation data products that do not include direct and diffuse radiation components may introduce large uncertainties in long-term climate change analysis. This is because global radiation alone does not account for the full range of solar radiation interactions with the Earth's surface, which can affect the accuracy of climate models and simulations.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 不包括直接和散射辐射成分的基于卫星的辐射数据产品可能会在长期气候变化分析中引入较大的不确定性。这是因为仅仅依靠全球辐射并不能考虑太阳辐射与地球表面相互作用的全部范围，这可能会影响气候模型和模拟的准确性。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the underlying goals of developing a long-term, high-accuracy dataset of daily surface solar radiation using surface radiation models?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 开发一个长期、高精度的日常地面太阳辐射数据集的潜在目标是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The goal is to contribute to climate change research and solar energy engineering applications by providing a dense, station-based dataset that helps in simulations of land surface processes, climate change analysis, and solar energy applications. This dataset aids in assessing solar energy potential, optimizing solar PV panel angles, and analyzing long-term variations and historical extreme events in solar energy systems.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 目标是通过提供一个密集的基于站点的数据集，来为气候变化研究和太阳能工程应用做出贡献。该数据集有助于模拟陆面过程、气候变化分析和太阳能应用。它有助于评估太阳能潜力、优化太阳能光伏面板角度，以及分析太阳能系统中的长期变化和历史极端事件。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: What are the motivations for utilizing both satellite and ground-based methods to estimate daily global, direct, and diffuse radiation in data collection?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 利用卫星和地面方法估计每日全球、直接和散射辐射的数据收集动机是什么？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: The motivation is to overcome the limitations of each method by combining their strengths. Ground-based methods provide high-accuracy data but are limited by the sparse distribution and high costs of maintenance, while satellite methods offer continuous spatiotemporal observations but lack long-term consistency and accuracy in direct and diffuse radiation estimates. Utilizing both methods allows for a more robust and comprehensive dataset that can better support various research and application needs.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 动机在于通过结合各自的优势来克服每种方法的局限性。地面方法提供高精度的数据，但由于分布稀疏和维护成本高而受到限制，而卫星方法则提供连续的时空观测，但在直接和散射辐射估计的长期一致性和准确性方面存在不足。利用这两种方法可以获得更强大和全面的数据集，更好地支持各种研究和应用需求。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What methodologies are utilized to estimate daily global, direct, and diffuse solar radiation in a station-based dataset, and how do they address the challenges associated with uneven distribution of radiation observation stations?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 用于估计基于站点的数据集中每日全球、直接和散射太阳辐射的方法论有哪些？它们如何应对与辐射观测站不均匀分布相关的挑战？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The methodologies used involve the hybrid model developed by Yang et al. (2006) for global radiation and the method by Tang et al. (2018) for direct radiation. Daily diffuse radiation is then calculated by subtracting direct radiation from global radiation. These methodologies help address the challenge of uneven distribution of radiation observation stations by providing a systematic approach to estimate radiation using routine meteorological variables observed at 2743 China Meteorological Administration weather stations.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 所使用的方法涉及Yang等人（2006）开发的全球辐射混合模型，以及Tang等人（2018）用于直接辐射的方法。然后通过从全球辐射中减去直接辐射来计算每日散射辐射。这些方法有助于解决辐射观测站分布不均的问题，通过利用2743个中国气象局气象站观测的常规气象变量提供系统的辐射估算方法。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How can routine meteorological variables be leveraged to construct a long-term dataset of surface solar radiation, and what are the main inputs required for this data collection process?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 如何利用常规气象变量构建长期的地面太阳辐射数据集，以及这一数据收集过程所需的主要输入是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Routine meteorological variables such as surface pressure, air temperature, relative humidity, horizontal visibility, and sunshine duration are leveraged to construct a long-term dataset of surface solar radiation. These variables are observed at 2743 CMA weather stations and serve as the main inputs needed for the development of the dataset, which spans over 60 years.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 常规气象变量，如地面气压、气温、相对湿度、水平能见度和日照时长，被用来构建一个长期的地面太阳辐射数据集。这些变量在2743个中国气象局气象站进行观测，并作为开发该数据集所需的主要输入，数据集的时间跨度超过60年。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedural steps are involved in validating a station-based solar radiation dataset against in situ observations, and how does this validation compare with satellite-based radiation products?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 验证基于站点的太阳辐射数据集与现场观测数据的程序步骤包括哪些？这种验证与基于卫星的辐射产品相比如何？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: The procedural steps for validation involve comparing the station-based radiation dataset against in situ observations and conducting comparisons with two satellite-based radiation products. The validation shows that the station-based dataset outperforms satellite-based products at both daily and monthly scales, with lower RMSE values for global, direct, and diffuse radiation, indicating higher accuracy.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 验证的程序步骤包括将基于站点的辐射数据集与现场观测进行比较，并与两个卫星辐射产品进行比较。验证结果显示，基于站点的数据集在日尺度和月尺度上均优于卫星产品，全球、直接和散射辐射的均方根误差（RMSE）值更低，表明其准确性更高。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What methods enable the construction of a long-term, high-accuracy dataset of daily surface solar radiation using existing meteorological observations?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些方法可以利用现有气象观测数据构建长期、高精度的日面太阳辐射数据集？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The construction of such a dataset is enabled by utilizing two surface radiation models: the global radiation estimation model by Yang et al. (2006) and the direct radiation estimation model by Tang et al. (2018). These models use routine meteorological variables like surface pressure, air temperature, relative humidity, horizontal visibility, and sunshine duration, observed at weather stations, to estimate daily global, direct, and diffuse radiation.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 该数据集的构建是通过利用两种表面辐射模型实现的：Yang等人（2006年）的全球辐射估算模型和Tang等人（2018年）的直接辐射估算模型。这些模型使用气象站观测的常规气象变量，如地面气压、气温、相对湿度、水平能见度和日照时数，来估算每日的全球辐射、直接辐射和散射辐射。

Enablement.QuestionEn: Which resources are crucial for enabling the development of a high-density solar radiation dataset over a long time period?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些资源对于长期开发高密度太阳辐射数据集至关重要？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Crucial resources for developing this dataset include the observational data from 2743 China Meteorological Administration (CMA) weather stations, which provide consistent and long-term coverage of surface pressure, air temperature, relative humidity, horizontal visibility, and sunshine duration, enabling the development of a solar radiation dataset spanning over 60 years.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 开发该数据集的关键资源包括来自2743个中国气象局（CMA）气象站的观测数据，这些数据提供了表面气压、空气温度、相对湿度、水平能见度和日照时长的一致且长期的覆盖，能够开发出一个超过60年的太阳辐射数据集。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the integration of satellite-based observations with station-based data sources be challenging in creating a comprehensive solar radiation dataset?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 将卫星观测与基于站点的数据源整合在一起，以创建全面的太阳辐射数据集可能面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The integration of satellite-based observations with station-based data sources can be challenging due to issues like inconsistent data quality, large uncertainties introduced by the fusion of multi-source satellites, and the limited ability of satellite products to provide direct and diffuse radiation due to algorithmic uncertainties.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 将卫星观测与站点数据源相结合可能面临挑战，原因包括数据质量不一致、融合多源卫星引入的大量不确定性，以及卫星产品在提供直接辐射和散射辐射方面的能力有限，这主要是由于算法不确定性所致。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What are the expected challenges in maintaining long-term and dense solar radiation datasets, particularly in areas with complex terrain?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在复杂地形地区，维护长期和密集的太阳辐射数据集预计会面临哪些挑战？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Maintaining long-term and dense solar radiation datasets in areas with complex terrain is challenging due to the uneven distribution of radiation observation stations, which are mostly located in flat and densely populated areas. Additionally, radiation measurements are prone to errors and unreliable data compared to other meteorological variables.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 在复杂地形地区，维护长期和密集的太阳辐射数据集是具有挑战性的，因为辐射观测站的分布不均，主要集中在平坦和人口稠密的地区。此外，与其他气象变量相比，辐射测量容易出现错误，数据可靠性较差。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: How do you evaluate the effectiveness of using hybrid models for estimating daily global and direct solar radiation in terms of accuracy and reliability?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 如何评估使用混合模型估计每日全球和直接太阳辐射的有效性，特别是在准确性和可靠性方面？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The hybrid models used for estimating daily global and direct solar radiation are considered highly effective as they show better performance in accuracy and reliability compared to satellite-based products. Validation with in situ observations shows lower RMSE values for daily and monthly scales, particularly for global and direct radiation.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 用于估计每日全球和直接太阳辐射的混合模型被认为是非常有效的，因为它们在准确性和可靠性方面表现优于基于卫星的产品。与现场观测的验证显示，特别是在全球和直接辐射方面，日尺度和月尺度的均方根误差（RMSE）值较低。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What are the potential challenges faced in collecting long-term and dense solar radiation data, and how might these challenges impact data accuracy and utility?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 收集长期和密集的太阳辐射数据可能面临的潜在挑战包括：设备维护和校准的困难、环境因素的影响（如天气变化和污染）、数据存储和管理的复杂性、以及资金和资源的限制。这些挑战可能会影响数据的准确性和实用性，导致数据不完整或不可靠，从而影响相关研究和应用的有效性。
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Challenges in collecting long-term and dense solar radiation data include the uneven distribution of radiation observation stations and the susceptibility of radiation measurements to errors and unreliable data. These challenges can impact data accuracy and utility by introducing inconsistencies and uncertainties, especially in complex-terrain and sparsely populated areas.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 收集长期和密集的太阳辐射数据面临的挑战包括辐射观测站的不均匀分布以及辐射测量易受错误和不可靠数据的影响。这些挑战可能通过引入不一致性和不确定性，影响数据的准确性和实用性，尤其是在复杂地形和人口稀少的地区。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m unsure about how meteorological variables like surface pressure and horizontal visibility contribute to estimating daily solar radiation.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定气象变量如地面气压和水平能见度如何有助于估算日照辐射。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Meteorological variables such as surface pressure, air temperature, relative humidity, horizontal visibility, and sunshine duration are crucial inputs for estimating daily solar radiation. These variables are used in radiation models to calculate global, direct, and diffuse radiation by considering the atmospheric conditions that affect solar radiation reaching the Earth's surface.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 气象变量如地面气压、空气温度、相对湿度、水平能见度和日照时长是估算每日太阳辐射的重要输入。这些变量在辐射模型中被用来计算全球辐射、直接辐射和散射辐射，考虑了影响到达地球表面的太阳辐射的气象条件。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I don't understand why satellite-based radiation products have limitations compared to station-based datasets.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不明白为什么基于卫星的辐射产品相比于基于站点的数据集有局限性。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Satellite-based radiation products often face limitations such as not having a long enough time series to meet the demand for climate change studies, inconsistent data quality due to sensor updates and multi-source fusion, and higher uncertainty in estimating direct and diffuse radiation compared to global radiation. In contrast, station-based datasets developed using hybrid models can provide more accurate and reliable data over long periods.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 基于卫星的辐射产品通常面临一些限制，例如时间序列不够长，无法满足气候变化研究的需求；由于传感器更新和多源融合，数据质量不一致；以及在估计直接辐射和散射辐射时的不确定性高于全球辐射。相比之下，使用混合模型开发的基于站点的数据集可以提供更准确和可靠的长期数据。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I’m confused about the challenges faced in ensuring the reliability of radiation data collected from ground stations.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我对确保从地面站收集的辐射数据的可靠性所面临的挑战感到困惑。
Assertion.AnswerEn: Challenges in ensuring the reliability of radiation data from ground stations include the uneven distribution of radiation observation stations, with most located in flat, densely populated areas, and fewer in complex terrains. Additionally, radiation measurements are prone to errors and unreliable data due to high maintenance and calibration costs, leading to issues such as erroneous or spurious data in the observations.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 确保地面站辐射数据可靠性的挑战包括辐射观测站的分布不均，大多数位于平坦、人口稠密的地区，而在复杂地形中的数量较少。此外，由于高维护和校准成本，辐射测量容易出现错误和不可靠的数据，导致观测中出现错误或虚假的数据。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the methods used for estimating daily global, direct, and diffuse radiation and evaluate their effectiveness.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请分析用于估计每日全球、直接和散射辐射的方法，并评估它们的有效性。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The methods used for estimating daily global, direct, and diffuse radiation involve two hybrid models. The global and direct radiation estimates are generated using the models by Yang et al. (2006) and Tang et al. (2018), respectively. The diffuse radiation is calculated by subtracting direct radiation from global radiation. The effectiveness of these methods is demonstrated by their performance in validation against in situ observations and comparisons with satellite-based products, showing that the station-based dataset outperforms satellite products at both daily and monthly scales, with lower RMSE values.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 用于估计每日全球、直接和散射辐射的方法涉及两种混合模型。全球辐射和直接辐射的估计分别使用Yang等人（2006）和Tang等人（2018）的方法生成。散射辐射通过从全球辐射中减去直接辐射来计算。这些方法的有效性通过与现场观测的验证和与基于卫星产品的比较得以证明，结果显示站点基础的数据集在日和月尺度上均优于卫星产品，具有更低的均方根误差（RMSE）值。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore potential sources or strategies for expanding or refining the availability of solar radiation datasets in regions with limited observational stations.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探索在观测站有限的地区扩展或完善太阳辐射数据集的潜在来源或策略。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Expanding or refining solar radiation datasets in regions with limited observational stations can involve increasing the use of satellite remote sensing to fill gaps in ground-based measurements, employing hybrid models that utilize routine meteorological variables such as surface pressure, air temperature, relative humidity, horizontal visibility, and sunshine duration, and integrating data from multiple satellites to enhance temporal and spatial coverage. Additionally, improving the algorithms for estimating direct and diffuse radiation can help in refining the dataset quality.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 在观测站有限的地区扩展或完善太阳辐射数据集可以通过增加卫星遥感的使用来填补地面测量的空白，采用混合模型利用常规气象变量，如地面气压、气温、相对湿度、水平能见度和日照时长，以及整合来自多个卫星的数据以增强时间和空间覆盖。此外，改进直接辐射和散射辐射的估算算法也有助于提高数据集的质量。
